Drop it like it’s hot!

Releasing your music to the world is a big deal, we get that. Our goal is to make that experience as smooth as possible. While our previous release flow was easy to understand, we wanted to make it more powerful. Our designers and developers have created a whole new experience that captures all the metadata and gives you a better overview of your hot new single or album. It will also help us process your release quicker. A total win-win. This is a big one, we hope you like it as much as we do. Try it out, go release some music!

In the latest version of the Amuse app, we have made some improvements and fixed a few bugs. Here is some of what we have done:

• In order to save you some time when uploading a new release, the genre for all tracks will be set to the same as on the first track you enter a genre for. (You can still set the genre per track, just like before.)
• Fixed a bug which meant that the Activity tab would not update unless you manually refreshed it. It now updates automatically.
• Made it easier to understand which track has errors if you get an error message when trying to submit your release.

To get your most wanted feature listed here, get in touch with us at support@amuse.io
Includes bug fixes.
General improvements and bug fixes.
This version brings general improvements and bug fixes. To get your most wanted feature listed here, get in touch with support@amuse.io

• ¡Amuse is now available in Spanish!
• Improvements and bug fixes.

This spankin' new version of the Amuse app includes:

• A makeover of the Music tab. Browsing your catalogue and checking the status of your releases just got a lot easier (and also looks a lot nicer)
• Better messaging for when something's gone wrong with your release
• Bug fixes (we keep crushing them) ¯\_(ツ)_/¯

• Bug fixes.

• Browsing your catalog and checking the status of your releases just got a lot easier. (And also looks a lot nicer!)
• Better information if something’s gone wrong with your release.

Performance improvements!
Bug fixes.
This update brings a handful of small improvements and bug fixes.

Money makes the world go round. It also makes artists happy! We’ve updated the Money section to make it easier for you to get an overview of your royalties and where they come from. Here’s a list of what it includes:

• See your income per month, per track and per store
• It’s faster!
• Updated design, it looks great!

The new Release Builder is here! And it is smarter and prettier than ever.
Some of the features we’ve added:
• Speed – No more reaching for that old-fashioned Save button on each and every screen. Just swipe back and forth between the screens. Swipe to remove tracks, contributors and featured artists. Smooth as silk.
• More helpful validation – No more rude error reports. Interactive hints guide you gently through the release process.
• Original Release Date – For those of you who move your releases over to us. (We love you!)
• Lyrics Language – So you can tell us what language you‘re singing/rapping/screaming in.
• Stability improvements – Leave your release and do something else. It will still be there when you return to the app.

• Original Release Date – For those of you who move your releases over to us. (We love you!)

• Stability improvements – Leave your release and do something else. It will still be there when you return to the app.

Improvements to signup and login.

You can now connect your featured artists and contributors to Spotify Artists, to make sure your release ends up on the correct artist pages.

We have also made some smaller improvements and design updates.

Bug fixes and performance improvements.

Forget the old Activity tab. Make way for the new tab in town, Streams! We are introducing better design and more functionality, all so that you can get more out of your data. We will keep on adding even more and better features in the coming months. So keep your eyes open for new updates.

The new features in the Streams tab are:

• Top tracks - See which your top 5 performing tracks are, either all-time or in the last 7 days
• Top countries - Are you big in Japan or growing an audience in Mexico?
• New graph - Use the graph to see how your catalogue is performing since your first release, or check how you’ve been doing for the last 7 days

You asked; we listened. Introducing Amuse Pro!
Did you know independent artists is the fastest-growing revenue sector in the music industry? We built Pro with them in mind. Our brand new set of tools helps artists and their teams
unlock the next level of their independent artist career. Upgrade to access features like fast lane releases and support, add team members with royalty splits and put your music on Instagram and TikTok.

You can now invite people from the contact list in your phone, to your team or to a royalty split.

Want to set the exact time when your song starts when shared on TikTok? Good news! Update the app and get your TikTok on. We also bring you a new design for the Account page, just tap the little cogwheel in the top right corner and see it in all its glory. It's a beaut! Also, one or two bugs were fixed.
We have crushed a few bugs and oiled some cogwheels, all to make your experience better.

Today, we're making our beloved feature Royalty Splits faster and better — for all our users! That's right, Royalty Splits is no longer a Pro-only feature.
What's new?
- Royalty Splits is available for non-Pro users*
- General polish to make the app look better and run smoother
*Users without A Pro subscription will pay a 15% commission on their royalty split. Check out support.amuse.io more information for non-Pro users.

We have tightened a few loose bolts and crushed some bugs.
We have tightened a few loose bolts and crushed some bugs.

Getting Pro features just got easier, no matter what part of the world you’re in. We’re localising payments and prices and will now:
- Display prices according to your local currency
- Charge you in your local currency

This means fewer bank declines, as well as even more artists getting access to Pro features like fast lane releases & support, team accounts and distribution to social media.
Enjoy!

We have tightened a few loose bolts and crushed some bugs.
Update on Streams tab! Users can now see streams for all their tracks by trending, all time streams, and for their latest tracks.
This new release contains some really nice design updates from our new engineer Julia and revamped Apple Sign Up flow!

This is a big one! We have revamped our Wallet so that it’s now easier than ever to check your royalties and withdraw money. We are now showing royalties per release — just tap it to expand and see your tracks. And we are bringing Fast Forward royalty advances back. It has been rebuilt from scratch — advancing yourself has never been easier. This update also adds faster technology and a new polished design.
We have tightened a few loose bolts and crushed some bugs.
We have tightened a few loose bolts and crushed some bugs.

Today we are making creating a release better and easier to use. We are grouping things that fit together and surfacing them in a more natural way. The new mobile design is highly inspired by how you create a release on our web service. Release info, track info, and distribution info are now on separate screens. Faster, and more efficient for you. We are also adding a way for you to handle all your royalty splits in one place.
